creator: alex+news@olmisoft.com
text:
Paths can be specified in config using '/' and retrieved from directory
structure on disk using '\'. Removing path prefix should ignore slash style.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
this would be better with a concrete example of what doesn't work, especially
since some time has elapsed since this bug was reported.

(In reply to comment #2)
> this would be better with a concrete example of what doesn't work

In my case, running under Windows and using forward slashes:

  <pathconvert property='test.path' pathSep=' '>
   <map from='C:/Build/' to=''/>
   <path>
    <pathelement location='C:/Build/lib'/>
   </path>
  </pathconvert>

  <echo>${test.path}</echo>

The prefix isn't removed. Using backslashes in both the prefix and the path
works, but I'm used to being able to use forward slashes in Ant under any platform.
creator: joe@kafsemo.org
alex+news@olmisoft.com
text:
The prefix is not removed on windows, because of:

- the file paths are returned in windows format, something like
C:\MyProjects\ProjectX\lib\somelib.jar

- the paths specified to search files and as the prefix usually I use something
like  ${basedir}/lib.

And when strings are compared, they do not match, because they use different
slashes. So prefix is not removed.
In my patch I added replace, making all slashes uniform.

I applied a slightly different patch.
Alexey - Thanks for the report and the patch.
Joseph - Thanks for the use case.
